string.text: Damn, you sacred me beast! I didn’t think it was possible for a person to be knocked out for so long. Speaking of which: Oh man, are we in deep shit.
The hell? What happened?

I don’t know, but I’m sure it’s nothing good. That creature must be playing tricks on us. Going to that place was a huge mistake. The minute I sent you that message, somebody whacked me over the head and I woke up here. I think this must be the monster’s lair. At first, I was happy because I thought I was out of the anomaly but when I opened my PDA, It turned out that I was still inside it. It turns out we are still inside the anomaly, only beneath the ground.
Yeah, that’s sad news indeed. What creature are you talking about?

I saw it a few times but I didn’t say a word about it to anyone. I thought that everyone would think I’ve gone off the deep end but I assure this creature is real. Physically the mutant looks like a bloodsucker but it acts and talks like a human being and it wears clothes like one. Also when it was close to me, I could see a profile in my contacts list with the name “Stronglav.” But that’s not the worst part. When I tried to shoot it, the creature just disappeared instantly and it was laughing at me beast, it fucking laughed. I don’t even know what to do...
I also saw that creature but I thought it was just a hallucination. We need to find way out of here. Marcus, don’t worry, we’ll get out of here.
You think I didn’t try that? Further into the cave there’s a ladder leading upwards but if you try to go there something teleports you back. Hold on... Can you feel that?!
What am I supposed to feel?
That smell... It’s like something is burning. That’s the scent I felt when I saw that creature for the first time. Don’t move, I think the owner of this lair is coming back.
Great, just what we needed.
Goddamn it, you blew our cover and you managed to grab the attention of those mutants.
I don’t know man, I wanted to ice that creature once and for all... What the hell happened?
How the hell should I know? Listen, we got to get the fuck out of here; that creature is going to comeback any minute now.
I Agree, we can’t stay here any longer. Let’s look for that exit.
I’m no condition to do that right now. How about I cover while you look around?
Fine, it’s not like we have a better plan.
Alright, Then you look for the exit and once you find it, message me, alright? Don’t worry about me, I can make it out on my own. Now go!
Alright, I’m on my way.
What the hell was that, Beast? What the hell is happening here? The creature is gone now, but I’m sure that it’ll be back pretty soon...
I can’t tell you, I can’t figure out myself what’s going on. .
It laughed again, Beast. It must’ve seen us. We need to get out of here, fast.
I Agree, we can’t stay here any longer. Let’s look for that exit.
I’m no condition to do that right now. How about I cover while you look around?
Fine, it’s not like we have a better plan.
Alright, Then you look for the exit and once you find it, message me, alright? Don’t worry about me, I can make it out on my own. Now go!
Alright, I’m on my way.
Hey Knucklehead, how are you feeling?
Not good, but I can handle it in the meantime. How about you, any news?
Alas, I only have two vaccines vial to give out and I can’t give it out to all three of you. I decided to give one of them to you.
No, Beast, I won’t take it, I rather you give it out to the other guys. Those two have their whole lives ahead of them, while I lived through most of mine. I much rather you save them, instead of me.
I’ll try to find another vaccine, we still have some time.
I appreciate your help, but for any case, let’s say our good byes now while I am still alive. This might be our last conversation.
No, it’s too early for that. I’ll find a cure.
I found some more of that vaccine, but it’s a really small amount.
I’m sorry Knucklehead but I gave the vaccine to someone else.
Let’s talk later.
Don’t worry, Beast, I understand, everyone has their own fate and if I have to die in this place then so be it. You shouldn’t blame yourself.
I’ll try to find another vaccine, we still have some time.
I appreciate your help, but for any case, let’s say our good byes now while I am still alive. This might be our last conversation.
No, it’s too early for that. I’ll find a cure.
That’s good to hear, do you have enough for everybody?
How are feeling, Marcus?
I want to say I’m fine, but that would be total bullshit. Beast, I’ve never felt so shitty in my life, I think I’m going to die soon. Have you managed to find a cure?
Yeah, I brought a dose of the cure for you, it should help.
Let’s talk later.
At least now I have a chance... Maybe I’ll get lucky and this thing will cure me. Alright, give me the medication.
Here you go, here’s the vial.
Thank you, Beast. This means a lot to me.
I wish could do more to help but alas this is all I can manage for now.
How are you feeling, Rezak?
Not too good... What’s up?
I have found some medciation for you.
Nevermind.
That’s good to hear. Did you find a lot of it?
No, only two vaccine vials, one of which I’m giving to you.
So either this vaccine cures me or I die, alright then. Either way, thanks, Beast.
I’m rooting for you, man.

Well, there isn’t much of a choice over here so you’re gonna have to adapt. You should go and kill a few boars and cook their meat on the campfire. Hey, I know it’s not exactly gourmet but at least you won’t be hungry.
What is it, merc?
Alright, if that’s the way it is then so be it. Is that all?
I’m running out of supplies and Savage said you can help me with that.

I don’t know if you are aware of this but we don’t really have any food left. Our last stock of canned goods and doctor’s sausages came from you. We have already ran out and that’s why we are going to have to go back to eating boar and blind dog even though it’s poisonous. However if it’s prepared correctly, it should be safe to eat.
I didn’t think I’d ever have to eat the local wild life but sense there isn’t any other choice...
How do you I prepare the meat correctly then?
I tell you what: First try and cook a piece and when you’re done, I’ll tell you wither you did right or not. But when you’re craving the boar, try to keep the fatty parts, they are tastier.
Fine, I’ll do that now.
Hold on, I know you... You are that same mercenary who helped me hunt down that psi-dog, am I right?
So Beast, have you brought the meat?
Yeah, here you go.
Not yet.
Yeah, you did everything correctly, this is perfectly edible. There’s almost no chance of getting poisoned from this.
Thanks for the very needed advice. At least, I have some steady source of food now.
Don’t mention it, merc. I hope that you remembered what you did there, it’s important that you do.
I remember, don’t worry. Aight, I got to go.
What do you need, merc?
Yeah, you’re right. It turns out the zone is smaller than I thought.
What do you need, merc?
Yeah, I agree. You guys sure caused some havoc back then... Don’t worry, I won’t say a word about it to anyone.
Everything that went down there was my job and nothing more.
Whatever you say... Alright, I won’t take any more of your time. See ya.
Hey.
What do you need, merc?
I am ready for the hunt.
Excellent, that means we can move out right now. The chimera should already be at the bunker.
I told you already, the chimera only goes to the bunker after midnight so you should know it’s way too early now. Come back at round 2 a.m.
Let’s go then.
Got it, I’ll come by then.
Alright, that’s all I needed to know.
The chimera only appears in the bunker during nighttime, so we might as well go right now.
Alright then, get over here at around 2 a.m, that’s the time the chimera usually appears at the bunker.
Hey, Beast, what’s up?
Let’s get going then.
Alright, I’ll to talk to you again at night.
Great, now we don’t have to worry about that chimera sneaking into our base any longer. Thanks for your help, Beast.
Don’t mention it, this chimera being dead benefits us all anyway. Hell, even I will sleep better knowing that this creature is dead.
Yeah. By the way, I bet you have noticed that are food sources are running out. The thing is, I have, for a week, been trying out this new source of food.
Hey, Beast, I heard you found Scavenger... Yeah, I never expected him to be such a piece of shit but what’s done is done. Anyway, I have something important to discuss with you.
And what is this new source of food?

While everyone else eats their canned goods, I have been eating the local wildlife. There’s a chance, of course, that by eating that type of meat you can get poisoned but if you cook it correctly then you shouldn’t have anything worry about.
Nothing wrong with that. Sure it’s not some gourmet dish but a wild boar is perfectly edible. I have tried their meat before.

I knew that you would get me, Beast. However, boars aren’t the only animal that’s edible here. Blind dog meat, for example, is far tastier and softer. Listen, how about we try and cook some of that meat right now? Go and hunt a few boars and try to prepare their meat in the campfire. At least we will have steady source of food that way.
Yeah, sure. I was getting hungry anyway.
Listen, can you bring me a piece as well, all this hunting has made me hungry.
Sure thing, Knucklehead.
So what’s up, Beast, have you brought the meat?
Yeah, here you go.
Alright, tell me what’s up, I’m all ears.
Not yet.
Alright... You even cooked it right, nice! Keeping cooking it this way, it’s the safest method. Anyway, Thanks.
Thanks for the advice. Good to know that there’s a food source always nearby.
By the way, before I forget, Marcus told me he wants to talk to you about something. Go see him, once you have some free time.
Alright, I’ll go talk to him.
Hey, Beast, what’s up?
By the way, before I forget, Marcus told me he wants to talk to you about something. Go see him, once you have some free time.
Alright, I’ll go talk to him.

We have a serious situation on our hands: A few days ago, I spotted a chimera not far from our base and sense I was alone and didn’t have much ammo, so I didn’t fight it... Good thing it didn’t see me. This is a very dangerous creature and if it sneaks into our base at night then we are all as good as dead.
What do you suggest we do?

We need to eliminate it. The safest way to do it is at night; when the mutant goes it sleep in its lair, in the bunker. The two of us can handle a sleeping chimera without a problem, it won’t even know what hit it. What do you think?
We are only the two of us going there? Why can’t we get any more help?

First of all, we are the only ones with enough ammo for the job and second, Two guys against a sleeping chimera is way more than enough. I fought these beasts before and I know this shouldn’t be a problem.
About your gun...
So, did you find it?
Yeah, here it is, take it. By the way, the bloodsucker that sacred you was waiting for me there.
Not yet.
Nah man, he didn’t scare me, I just had no other choice but to run.
Stop making excuses, I don’t care either way. Here’s your gun.

Thanks man, really appreciate it. Now I can go on raids like everyone else and not stay behind. Plus it’s a lot safer here when you have a gun. Here’s a small reward for your good work. I don’t need this money here anyway but perhaps you will need it later.
Thanks. I’ll be on my way.
So... Where did you lose your gun? Can you at least give me a ballpark location?
I can tell you the exact location and I know where the gun is.
So what’s the problem then? Why can’t you just get the gun yourself? It would take less effort then bothering me.

The thing is, I didn’t lose the gun, I threw it away. When I was scouting, I was attacked by a bloodsucker and my gun jammed. I had no time to clear the malfunction, so I threw the gun at the bloodsucker, shot him a few times with my pistol and ran away. I can’t tell that to the general because running away from a mutant is considered a cowardly act and going out there alone with a single handgun is near suicide. Help me out here merc, I’ll owe you big time.
Well, what can you do? Alright I’ll look for your gun.
Stay right there and don’t move a muscle! Who are you and what are you doing here?
Take it easy lieutenant. I’m a mercenary and I came here you to reactivate the transformer.
Let’s pretend I believe you... How did you open the cage door?
Someone helped me open it. What about you? How long have you been stuck here?
And you think I’m going to tell you all that? Go talk to the general, he should be more inclined to discuss these things.
Fine, I’ll go talk to him then.
Yo, merc... Give me some water, please... I can’t go on much longer.
The fuck? I can’t walk up to you. I’m trying to get to you but I keep getting teleported back. What the fuck is going on?

An anomaly, most likely... Only really small. I can’t get out of here and I’ve ran out of food and water. As for the other guys well, one guy disappeared somewhere while the rest are all dead. The major, he went batshit all of a sudden and started killing people after which he shot himself in the head. So I am left here alone.
Hold on, I was just here a while back and everything was fine. You sent me message just a second ago? How the hell did all of this happen so fast?
A while back? A whole week has passed sense the moment I sent you that message. After that, I tried to make contact but my pda died all of a sudden.
A whole fucking week!? What the hell is going on even? How the fuck is any of this possible?
I don’t know and I don’t really give a shit anymore...Go away merc, leave me alone.
Goodbye, general.
Greetings, stalker. Do you have some spare food by any chance? We are all just tired of eating mutant meat and are really craving some real food.
No, general, I don’t. I could go for some real food myself right now.

Yeah, I thought so. Listen, we are not asking for it for free. When we were out on our raid, we collected a couple of artifacts and wanted to sell them off the scientists but couldn’t due to our current circumstance. How about you give us some food and we will give you the artifacts? Canned goods, sausages, bread... We don’t really care what as long as it’s real food. Bring us at least 8 pieces. Deal?
Alright, general. I’ll try and find some food for you.
Sorry, I can’t help with that.
So, Beast, are you helping us or what?
So... Have you found some food?
Hey, stalker! What the hell is going on in here? Where are we?
Here you go, general. It took some effort to find it...
Yeah, okay. Alright, you did your part, good job. Here’s your artifacts, when you finally get out of here you can sell them for a good price.
Not yet.
Great. Yeah, Only I’m not so sure we will ever get out of here, although I hope we do. Alright, goodbye general.
Hold on, stalker, there might be another job for you. When we were out of the bunker, Tug dropped his gun. Perhaps you can help him find it.
Sure, I’ll help. Where did he drop it, roughly?
Go ask him, he should know where it is.
Alright, I’ll go talk to him.
Hello, merc.
I’d like to know that myself... by the looks of it, we are inside some kind of anomaly. Do you remember how you got here?
A spatial one.

A spatial one. You are not alone here by the way, there’s a group of stalkers nearby and they have been stuck here for a while. More than 2 months to be exact. So, do you remember how you ended up in here?
Fuck! Another “gift” from the zone. All, I remember is that we were walking through Agroprom and then we saw a bright light. After that, we woke up here.
Alright, I need to turn on the electricity right now, I’ll talk to you later.
Hello, merc.
I see you are finally starting to grasp the seriousness of the situation... I’ll ask again, where the fuck is the Compass?
Fucking hell, I am not lying. You know me, you know I don’t lie about these things.

Times change and so do people. Take you for example: Your friends now are a bunch of peasant stalkers who got stuck inside the spatial anomaly. You were unpredictable before so who knows what the hell is in your head now. Alright, I’m getting tired of this conversation, Mrakobes told to take you outside so that’s what I’ll do.
Wait! No, hold on...
Wake up, asshole. Welcome back to the real world...
What the hell is going on? What the fuck are you doing?
Wrong answer... But I’ll give you another chance.
I’m telling the truth, I don’t have any artifacts.
I came here to check up on you, Jackal was beginning to worry where you gone off to.
Do you even know what this place is or better yet, how you’re going to get out of here?

Why would I want to leave? We just came, plus we might like it here. And if we would want to get out of here we could using our scanner. By the way, I should take that away from you. You know, for safe keeping...
Why the hell did you even come here? To save me?
You think too highly of yourself, Beast. Think, why would we save you? We have a mission related to this anomaly. You and your friends give us the Compass and we go away peacefully.
What are you talking about?
Compass is a type of artifact, Stop pretending you don’t know what I am talking, you should’ve found it by now. Okay either you give it to me or things will get ugly fast.
We don’t have it and even if we did we wouldn’t give it you.
You need any help?

Good thing you’ve asked merc. Our generator is running out of fuel and there isn’t any left in the jerry cans. If we don’t find fuel for it then we won’t have any electricity which means no light in our base. We need it to see mutants during night time. If you manage to find some fuel I’ll give you a couple of bandages and a medkit. I’d give you more than that but you know how it is in this shithole.
Alright, I’ll try and find some.
I’m kinda busy right now, maybe later.

Our generator is running out of fuel and there isn’t any left in the jerry cans. If we don’t find fuel for it then we won’t have any electricity which means no light in our base. We need it to see mutants during night time. If you manage to find some fuel I’ll give you a couple of bandages and a medkit. I’d give you more than that but you know how it is in this shithole.
Alright, I’ll try and find some.
I’m kinda busy right now, maybe later.
I don’t need your help but thanks for asking.
Well, if you managed to befriend a dutyer than surely a mercenary won’t be a problem.

Yeah, Snake’s a good dude and we managed to find something in common. This place forced has to work together, it’s impossible to survive any other way here. Plus, I am far more concerned with getting out of here then fighting in some endless faction war.
Hey, merc. I’m listening...
So what’s merc, have you managed to find some fuel?
Yeah, I did, actually.
Not yet.
Best news I heard all week. At least now we won’t have to worry about electricity for a while. Give it to me.
Yeah, Here you go.
Merc, let’s talk later. First we got to get rid of these zombies.
Thanks, merc, you helped us big time. Here, just like I promised, Two bandages and a medkit, they should prove useful.
No need to thank me, we are all helping each other after all.
Yeah, merc, I’m listening.
Alright, See ya.
Okay, I’ll be on my way then.
You should go get some sleep man... Plus, I’m in no mood to talk.
Hello, merc. I should probably introduce myself... Everyone here calls me Sledgehammer and I used to be a freedomer, not anymore though. This place made me change my outlook on life.
Well, you already know that my name is Beast.

I’m not going to lie and pretend that I’m glad you are here. Your faction was a constant threat to us. If I would have seen you a few months ago, we wouldn’t be having this conversation but like a said before this place changed me.
Merc, where the hell were you? I was getting tired of waiting for you.
Where’s everyone else...
They’ve already left. I’m the only one who stayed behind to wait for you. You said something about some dutyers, aren’t they coming?
Sadly, they’re dead. Where are we going exactly?
Let them rest in peace then... Where will the exit lead us, I don’t know. Alright, so are you ready to leave?
Yes. Ready as I’ve ever been.

Just so you know, once you exit the anomaly, there’s a chance you will pass out. Usually, that doesn’t happen but there’s still a chance. I’m just warning you in advance, just in case. Alright, now when we exit, you need to stick close by me and follow my exact path. Don’t stop even for a second. Any questions?
No, lets go.
Thank you, young man. I’ve defiantly wouldn’t have handle it myself, I’m way too old for these kind of things. I don’t know what’s going on but the wild life in the zone has really gotten crazy.
Don’t mention it, old timer. Who are you but the way?

They call me forester and I live in the red forest, heard of that place? I caught your call for help on my radio and went to help you out with my Compass. I’m guessing you are the one who called for help? Or is there someone else stuck here with you?
Wait, so you came here to save us?
That’s exactly right, son. That’s why a brought the Compass with me, this artifact shows you the way out of this place.
Well, I am not alone here. There’s a stalker base not far from here and there’s a squad of dutyers stuck underground.
Well then, show me the way to your base so I can meet all the rest of you.
Sure, follow me.
Alright, enough about that, right now we need to take the bodies out of the bunker and bury them and we need to pay respect to Sledgehammer.
Alright, let’s go.
Hey, Beast, who did you bring this time?
He calls himself forester and says he can get us out of the anomaly.
Are you serious!? I need to talk to him as soon as possible and while I do that you should check out another signal.
Another signal? Where’s it coming from?
It’s almost in the same place as you were before, I’ll send you the coordinates. Go there and check it out while I talk to Forester.
Fine, I’ll go check it out. Give me the coordinates.
Alright, you should get them in a second.
Excellent work, Beast! Now, at the very least, we have some light. How did everything go?
Alright, I’ll be on my way then.
Beast, let’s talk later. First check the signal.
So Beast, Any good news? Have you managed to find any meds that may help our sick? their situation is really bad, if they don’t get any medication in the next two days, they will surely die.

I did find some meds, for one use only though. What’s worse though that there’s isn’t enough medication for everybody seeing that there only two doses of this shit. And even these two doses might not do anything... Man, we should have known eating mutant meat was a bad idea.

The important thing right now is not to give up. Right now, more than ever, we have to keep fighting. There’s a different problem though: I don’t think I can choose who gets the medication. Can you make that decision for me?
It’s a tough decision but some has to do it, I guess it’s gonna have to be me.
Thank you, I could have done it myself. Quick reminder, the people that are sick are: Knucklehead, Marcus, and Rizak. Good luck, Beast.
See you later.
When I was in the underground, I found a squad of dutyers. Five people to be exact.
So, Beast, have you gave out the meds?
Not yet.
You were gone for a few days, where the hell were you?
I was out all this time looking for a cure, I even slept inside the barn for a higher chance of encountering survivors.
Yeah, about that… Knucklehead died last night and we buried him.
And I never even told him goodbye...

I myself didn’t get the chance to tell him my goodbyes; I was still hoping he might get better... You said you were looking for meds, did you find anything? Marcus and Rizak are feeling better but they are still sick. Oh yeah, we found this in Knuckleheads stuff, it’s for you.
No, sadly I couldn’t find anything.
Who would have thought... Do you know how long they have been stuck there?
Too bad... Let’s hope that they will get better with what they have. Alright, you should get some rest after all that endless searching and as for me, I need some alone time.
See you around, Savage.
No, they got here only recently.
Did you say anything about us?
I told them about our group but they didn’t want to join us.
Well, if they don’t want to join us, then I see no reason for asking them. I don’t really give a shit as long they don’t start causing trouble when they run out food.
I wouldn’t worry about that, If we managed to fight off the mercenaries then surely they won’t be a problem.
How are you Beast? How’s Screw, is he alright? I think that Marcus already told you what happened.
Yeah, everything is alright. I killed all the mercenaries that were in the barn. Screw’s with me, he’s fine.
Too bad that Dagger escaped along with a few other assholes; they have probably already exited the anomaly. Don’t worry though, I’ll make him pay for Sledgehammer’s death.
That peice of shit, he stole the scanner to boot...

So you found him? Although, that doesn’t matter that much now, does it? Listen, I’ve been thinking: now that we have access to the bunker we should stay here, it’s a safer place. I already talked to the guys and they think it’s a good idea. What about you?
Yeah, this place is way better than the barn. It’s a no brainer.
Glad we are all on the same page. By the way the mercenaries we managed to capture tried to escape so we had to kill them.
They knew the risk... Anyway, did Marcus tell you that he found the key to the storage room? There should be plenty of ammo there.

Yeah, he already told me about it, this is great news indeed. Alright, there will be enough time to chit chat later but right now we have to find a way to turn on the electricity. When you turned off the power in the barn you also turned it off here in the bunker and when Screw tried to turn it back on it wouldn’t work. There must be a transformer somewhere nearby and we need to reactivate it in order to turn on power. Me and Rizak were looking around and we found some blueprints according to which the transformer should be not far from the barn underneath the ground. Screw said he can unlock the door leading to the underground. He’s already waiting for you near the door so I suggest you get going.
Right, I’ll get going then.
What the hell happened? Did you ice those two guys?
No, it wasn’t me. The stronglav appeaered out of nowhere and made these to guys kill themselves.
Holy shit, he can do that!? Fuck, we are lucky to be alive... Alright what’s most important right now is to free the other guys from captivity. Luckily, I have a plan.
And what’s your plan?
A few of our guys are still held up in the barn, they are guarded by a few mercs. First we free them and then we go for the rest.
Not like we have any better choice... By the way, how did you manage to get out of the cave?

Nothing too complicated really: after you climbed out, I just followed you and managed to find my way out. When I finally climbed out, I could piss myself from happiness... But anyway, we are getting side tracked and we have to get moving fast. Follow me.
Fine, let’s go.
Alright, this place is an old military reserve and it should have plenty of firepower. I don’t for how long these weapons have been stored here but let’s hope they all work.
How are you going to open the door?

I found the key to it when I was inside the Stronglav’s lair. I’ve already taken some stuff out of there but there’s still plenty to go around in there. Here’s the key, take all you need while I wait for you here and guard the area.
Alright, I won’t take too long.
Beast, get a move on... Take what you need and let’s get going.
Alright, I won’t take too long.
So, are you ready?
Yeah, ready.

Okay so, listen up. Even though most of the mercs are at the bunker, there’s still a big chunk of them in the barn. They are holding Screw hostage there for some reason, and we need to save him. The best option we have right now is to kill the electricity and uses the darkness to our advantage. What do you think? Also, I need to ask you something.
Your plan is solid. As for your question, this isn’t the best time for chit-chat right now.

Well, it’s about our current situation. Are you sure that you are going to be able to fight these guys? There’s a chance that you might ran into an old friend among them, you used to work for the syndicate after all.
Don’t worry, there shouldn’t be any problem. These assholes were never my friends.
There’s a chance, I might ran into someone I know but I have to do what needs to be done. Our lives are at stake here.
Huh... Alright then. If that’s the case then let’s not waste any more time. Alright, you go take care of the mercs in the barn while go help the rest.
You’re right about that... Alright, you go take care of the mercs in the barn while go help the rest.
Got it, I’ll join you when I’m finished here.
When you’ll be ready, talk to snake. He’ll mark the location on your pda.
Got it.
Beast, this is no time to chit chat. We got to take out this fleshes.
Hey, Beast! I noticed you’re not too bad of a detective. First, you and Knucklehead found the chimera then you found Scavenger and uncovered all of his dirty deeds.
Alright, what’s your point?
We need your help. Before Savage came along we had a different leader by the name of Shell. Good guy... Only he disappeared.
And how long has it been?

About a month. Even though, it’s most likely that he is dead but I did catch the signal of his pda a few days ago when I was near the abandoned basement, although only for a split second. I tried looking everywhere but couldn’t find anything. Maybe he, like Scavenger, used teleports to move around but got stuck somewhere... Maybe you can find him.
This no time to flap your gums! The zombies are closing in and you are the only one with ammo to spare so get going and then maybe will talk.
You think he could survive all this time on his own?

Anything is possible here, plus he’s one of the tough ones. He wore an exoskeleton and always carried a PKM with him. The last time he was seen, he had plenty of food and ammo so there might be a chance he’s still alive. Shell was a great leader and he’s the one who made us work together in the first place. That’s quite an accomplishment considering we have stalkers from rivaling factions.
Alright, I’ll try and look for Shell. Who knows? Maybe I’ll get lucky.
Greetings, merc! I haven’t had the chance to meet you yet but my name’s Marcus. First of all, I wanted to thank you for helping us out, now, at the very least we have some resources to spare.
Don’t mention it... My name’s Beast by the way but you should already know that.

Yeah you’re right about that. So this place is called spatial anomaly right? So it turns out there’s supposed to be a way out of here, we just have to find it. By the way, are you busy right now? I need your help.
Nope. What do you need?
No, my hands are full right now.

Nothing too difficult, all you have to do is find me a Wrenched. This artifact cleanses your body of radiation very well. There are plenty of gravitational anomalies here so finding one shouldn’t that much of a problem. I’d go myself but I am all out of ammo. As for the reward, don’t worry, I’ll give you a different artifact in return. Even though it’s radioactive, it does have some positive qualities.
Alright, I’ll try to find you a “wrenched”.
So are you still busy?
Not anymore, what’s the job?
Still busy.
So, Beast how’s the artifact search going?
Yeah, It’s here.
No, I haven’t found it yet.
That’s awesome! I can stop worrying about antirads... It’s been two weeks sense I ran out. Doesn’t matter though, this artifact does the job way better. Give it to me.
Hey, Beast. Me and the guys are planing to go find some food and we need your help.
Here, take it.
Here’s your reward. I’m really grateful for what you have done.
Sure, I’ll be glad to help.
Hey, Beast! any news?
So, Beast, any news about Shell?
When I found Shell, he was zombified so I had to kill him.
No news yet.

That’s really fucked up. Man, he shouldn’t have ever left on his own like that, if he hadn’t he would probably be alive right now. How the hell did you manage to kill him though, wasn’t he wearing an exoskeleton?
So how do you need my help?
It was really hard but I managed to do it somehow...
Did he have anything interesting on him?
No, only this dogtag, here have a look.
Yeah, that’s his dog tag alright... Thank you, beast. Here’s a reward for your hardwork.
feel free to ask for help anytime. Alright, see you around.
Hey, beast! What’s up?
Rizak told me that you saw some Fleshes nearby. We decided that, since we don’t have any other food, we are going to eat flesh meat. You wanna help us out?
Alright, we will talk later.
Alright, let’s talk later.
Snake, Sledgehammer, and I will come with you but I have do something first so I’ll join a bit later. In the meantime make sure those two won’t start fighting with each other.
Got it, Marcus. Alright, send me coordinates.
I help, Don’t worry.
So, Beast, have you found the SVD ammo yet?
Yeah, I have the ammo, here.
No, not yet.
Excellent work, man. I never thought you could actually find them here.
Yeah, okay. Where’s my reward?
Here it is, just like I promised.
Thanks. Alright, I’ll be on my way.
Hey Beast, what do you need?
Yo, Beast, Thanks for taking care of those zombies. Are you busy now? I need your help with something.
Nope. What do you need?
So, have managed to find some free time?
Yeah, what do you need?

I have an SVD stashed nearby, only there’s one problem, I don’t have any ammo for it. Can you help me find some ammo for it? Even a single pack will suffice for now. I will give you some ammo for your ak in exchange and I’ll throw some cash on top. So, are you in?
No, I’m too busy right now.
Sorry, I’m too busy
LLook who it is... Hello, creature, what the hell are you doing here?

I could ask you the same question... Do you even know where you are? You have no idea how much you’ve fucked up by coming here. Anyway, either you get out of my way right now or I am going to shoot you in the head.
Huh... Look at you talk like you’re all tough and shit. No worries though, you’re going to be singing a different tune soon enough. By the way, the syndicate says hello.
I’m going to...
Thank you, Beast. This is the second time you’re saving my skin. Are the mercenaries really here because of me?
No. They’re here for some kind of artifact... Compass it’s called, they think we have it. What’s even worse though is that these pieces of shit killed Sledgehammer.
Man, this some fucked situation we’re in... That means that there still some mercs out there and there holding our friends hostage.
Yeah, Marcus is working on a way to free them.
Listen, you better go help him and as for me, the mercs fucked me up pretty bad so I better just hang back here. What do you say?
Fine, Stay here then.
Oh, you finally came? Did Savage tell you what you need to do?
Yeah, he did.

Then let’s go. I help you open the door but remember I am not going down there with you; I don’t know what’s in there. I’ll open the entrance and head back to base, not like you need my help anyway. So, are you ready?
Yeah, let’s go.
They told me to find a battery for the radio, so give it here.
Yeah, Merc, what is it?
Then give that battery to the man. In the meantime, I’m gonna catch my breath.
All right. I’m off.
Thanks for the help, man. I think we can exchange a few words now.
You said a few mercenaries were after you. Why?

Well, basically, the scientists gave me an assignment to try out a radio transmitter. If I remember their words correctly: “Just test it out and see if you pick up anything.” I messed around with the hunk of junk and happened to pick up a mercenary channel, and man, they were having some serious negotiations. I heard it all, mouth shut. Didn’t even move a muscle. Then, all of a sudden, the mercs got that someone was listening in on them and ordered everyone to sweep the area, and that’s when this whole shitstorm started. Because of my screwup, the place was crawling with mercs within minutes. I randomly happened upon an anomaly; good thing it didn’t happen to be a whirligig or anything… No, it was some kind of space anomaly. And now I’m here.
Do you still have that transmitter?

I have it, but it looks like it broke when I was sent here. When I was running away from the mercs, I threw it into my backpack, and when I left the anomaly, I dropped the backpack. Now, the transmitter is more of a puzzle game than a working device.
Did any of the parts inside the transmitter survive?
All right. Let me have the battery for now. I’m going.
A couple of busted microchips… and a battery that I could give you if you have any use for it.
Merc, who the hell are you, God damn it? Answer or I’ll open fire!
Calm down. I’m here to help. I go by Beast.
Calm your tits… or do you want me to calm you down myself?
You’re dead, merc… All of you are dead…
That’s your choice…
Here to help, huh? You pulling my leg or something? What the hell do you mercs want from me, anyway? I never heard anything! Go away!
“You”? Who are you talking about? There are no mercs here but me.
Let’s say you’re telling the truth… Wait. You said “here.” What do you mean by that?
Oh, man. Fortune doesn’t smile on you. You’ve ended up in a spatial anomaly.
What? Damn! I need to get out of here, immediately! The mercs will be here soon. They’ve seen where I ended up…
Don’t panic. We’ll go to the base and talk about everything.
Is it far? Are there other stalkers there?
Like I said: we’ll talk about it when we’re there. Come on.

Mercenary, you’re very lucky that phantom didn’t take you with it. If you hadn’t passed its trial, you’d never be waking up after that. Phantoms are extremely deceptive, but that which gives rise to them is much more dangerous.
Wait. What are you saying? Who are you, even?
That’s not our priority to discuss. You need to stay away from phantoms. They’re very dangerous. Remember that…
What’s going on here? What are phantoms?

What you saw here last night was a phantom. Phantoms are the souls of dead people; they appear at the site of their death, or close to their dead body. Normally, they aren’t dangerous, but the phantom you saw here was made to lure someone into a trap.
Then, the one who did it didn’t succeed. I mean, I escaped.
You have more fortune than the stalker who came here before you, but you cannot always rely on your chances. Be vigilant, mercenary, and do not let yourself fall into another trap.
How do you know all of this, old man?
I know much. Follow my advice; you are in danger. Do not let yourself be deceived. Farewell, mercenary. I hope we see each other again.
What?! Hey! Wait! How are you going to leave the anomaly?!
I can do it… Why don’t I want this to… with me… This thing…
Hey, man, what’s going on with you? You all right?

There’s a lot I don’t remember… At the Radar… we decided to take a shortcut… We went through the Red Forest… As it turns out… there were no dangers there… There’s a hole in the fence… I can get around a few Monolith patrols… No… No… You…
What?

I don’t remember… The voice is calling… I need to get… I was there! I’ve seen it! It got into my head and spoke to me. It spoke to me! A terrible voice sounded in my head, scorching my brains out. Terrible… Terrible. Terrible! Do not go there! It will become you, just as it became me. A wild pain in my head… And the voice… whispers to me.
Calm down, buddy. Everything’s alright. You’re safe here.

A whisper… A whisper and the creaking of swings… It’s in my head, and I’ve become a monster myself. No. I can’t. Friend, hand over my artifact to Baldy. That’s all I found there when It came into my head. Baldy will give it to my wife, my son. This will compensate them…
What’ll compensate them?…
I’m fine! I’m fine… I can contain myself. I can…
Do you hear me?!
No! It won’t be with me! It will not be with me!
Answer me already!
My skull… It’s tearing at me… It’s… I’m Spotty. Radiation… took him! Hunchback! Hunchback is dead!
Hunchback? Who’s Hunchback?
A stalker… We went together to the Scorcher. Hunchback, Savage, and I.
What did you do at the Scorcher?
First, we have to eliminate the nearby zombies, or else, they’ll be taking us with them. Do you have any ammunition for my Kalashnikov?
I would if I’d never have woken up in this place…
Then give me two packs. I’ll share them with Mosquito. He’s a good shot. You guys can take care of yourselves.
Okay. Take the ammo.
Okay. This is bad.
We should find Scavenger. Without him, we won’t last very long.

Welcome back from the world beyond, buddy… Nobody was thinking you’d be coming back to your senses; you were unconscious for four days. Hmm… That blowout messed you up bad. Nobody would’ve survived that… or so we thought. You’re alive. Whether that’s a good thing or a bad thing is something I don’t know. The fact remains that this is very strange, though. Very strange indeed. Anyway: you seem to be an all right man, but your merc attributes seem a little suspicious. Whose side are you on?
I’m Beast: a mercenary… What is this place, and who are you?…

Hmm. A mercenary? Looks like I was right… Well then, merc: answering your first question is going to be difficult, because I myself don’t know where exactly we are. This place here is mystical; we’ve been here for a long time, and all the while, the Zone’s been messing with us. I’m Savage. Nice to meet you. By the way, though, the guys aren’t very happy about having a mercenary around here, so I’m going to ask you to behave yourself. We’re all in a rather difficult situation; many nerves have been shot around here. Let’s all get along here and manage without any conflicts.
Merc, now would be a great time for your assistance… Zombies are approaching our base. We have to take them out, or this place is going to be overrun within seconds.
What do you mean? How is this place “mystical”?

I don’t know, merc. There’s no way out of here… You go anywhere, you always end up back at this godforsaken barn. We barely make ends meet around here, living another day without escaping malnutrition or any of the local mutants. Lost a lot of munitions, too, and that’s not counting any of the mutants. Only God knows how they keep finding a way here.
Damn… What have I gotten myself into? How long have you been here, and where is my equipment?

Another stalker and I have been holed up here for about seven months. The others: about one to three months… As for your equipment, four days ago, one of our men scouted the neighborhood and stumbled upon your unconscious self. I have no idea about the location of your stuff. All you had on you was a pistol, a few magazines, and your suit, which was close to looking like a floorcloth. It’s obvious that I can’t force you to follow my orders, but I suggest you join our group so that you’ll have a chance of biting the dust a little later than if you go on by yourself. In addition, we’d be very interested in having a man of your talents around. I hope you’ve heard my words and understood everything; otherwise, you’ll have a few more problems on your hands.
I understand. I have no ill intentions toward you and your men.
Is nobody else able to help?

We don’t have time to worry about that. You need to help Cutter. He’s the one who you brought you here, even if some of our men were against it. Now, it’s your turn to repay the favor. And, I noticed a few Kalashnikov mags in your uniform. If you hand me two of them, I can help you out. Deal?
I can’t even remember how I ended up here.

Damn this place! What do we do? Without rations or munitions, we won’t last a week! We haven’t seen any new stalkers for almost two months. Usually, they die in anomaies, and we live off all their possessions, but now… And on top of that, Scavenger’s gone off somewhere.
We’ll figure something out. Don’t worry.
Who’s Scavenger?
Scavenger? If it wasn’t for him, we’d all be worm food right now! He scouted the area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and didn’t return.
I think so. The hard part’s over with; his wounds aren’t fatal anymore. He’ll be able to move a bit faster soon.

Beast, if it wasn’t for Scavenger, we’d all be dead right now. He combed the whole area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned… He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him, Cutter and Mosquito, but they didn’t find him. Instead, what they found was you. Here’s what I don’t get, though: how did you manage to survive in the first place? There were blind dogs no further than ten meters from where you were found.
I don’t know how I’m still alive, but that’s the important part. Anyway, I’ll go check out the area. Maybe I’ll find something.
I don’t know how I’m still alive, but that’s the important part. Anyway, I’ll go check out the area. Maybe I’ll find something.
It’d mean a lot. No one can really replace Scavenger; he gathered so much stuff in a single day, and we can’t even match half of his efforts.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot you a message.
It’d mean a lot. No one can really replace Scavenger; he gathered so much stuff in a single day, and we can’t even match half of his efforts.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot you a message.

Speak to Knucklehead on that matter. He’ll help you solve the issue. Oh, also: Snake wanted to see you. Said that he’s got an important matter. After you’re done with that, you come to me. I’ve got something else for you.
Well, this is great. I thought this was going to be our ticket to freedom. This anomaly doesn’t want to let us free… How’s that soldier? He going to live?
That’s great. I have a feeling this place used to be some kind of military area before the anomaly showed up. Maybe the jarhead can give us some info about it.
All right. I’ll go talk to him.
Hi there, Beast. You need something from me?
I need your help with a little something… We had this stalker. Called him Scavenger. He went missing two days ago, but I don’t want to think that he’s dead.
Hi there, Beast. You need something from me?
Hi there, Beast. You need something from me?
Maybe so, but in his current state, he can barely even stand. Let him have some rest.

Yeah. No need to bother him right now. I’m quite sure we have enough medicine to get him on his feet eventually. Too bad we have no actual medics. By the way, I see you’re looking much better than before. Sleep did you some good.
Yeah. I feel better; at least my headache’s over… I have some provisions with me. Do you guys have any rations?
That’s great, Beast. Remember when I told you about Scavenger?
The one who snatched loot from local corpses and brought it back here?
What about him?

Yeah. Scavenger combed the whole area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned. He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him, Cutter and Mosquito, but they didn’t find him. Instead, what they found was you. Here’s what I don’t get, though: how did you manage to survive in the first place? There were blind dogs no further than ten meters from where you were found.
So that’s where the zombies came from. An unexpected guest showed up at our doorstep, though. Thanks for helping us take it out, Beast. I won’t forget that.
I helped you, and later, you’ll be helping me… No reason to be grateful, Savage.
It’ll mean a lot if you find him. Scavenger was a good stalker. He’s been a great help to us.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot a message.
All right. We should get out of here, else the pseudogiants will show up.
We’ll figure something out. I’ll try to find a way out of here. Do you have anything else for me to do?
Yes, Beast. Remember when I told you about Scavenger??
The one who snatched loot from local corpses and brought it back here?
I remember him, but I don’t know who he is.

Yeah. Scavenger combed the whole area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned. He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him, Cutter and Mosquito, but they didn’t find him. Instead, what they found was you. You helped us eliminate both the zombies and the controller, and for that, Beast, I thank you.

Beast, if it wasn’t for Scavenger, we’d all be dead right now. He combed the whole area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned… He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him, Cutter and Mosquito, but they didn’t find him. Instead, what they found was you, but I’m glad you showed up. You helped us eliminate both the zombies and the controller, and for that, Beast, I thank you.
No need to thank me. I’ll go comb the area; maybe I’ll find something.
So, what did you find there, merc? Did you deal with the zombies?
Yes. The zombies have been neutralized. Mosquito’s fine as well.
Hmm. A spatial anomaly, you say? Does the note have any clue about an exit?
No. I have a question, though: how did zombies end up here?
The zombies are down, but… they got Mosquito.
That’s good news, merc! Did you find anything interesting on those fellas?
How? Ugh. I’m sorry for the guy… But what’s better: staying around here waiting for starvation or leaving for another world?…
Yes. The first thing I found was some info about the zombies: they were all part of Duty. I retrieved a note from one of them.
Yeah. I wanted to tell you, though: all the zombies were part of Duty, and one of them carried a note.
What’s written there?
What’s written there?
The note describes this very place: we’re inside some kind of anomaly. The Dutyer described this anomaly as spatial. I’ve heard about it before…

Damn. My head… What the hell attacked us?! Okay, at least we know how the zombified stalkers ended up here, even if an unexpected guest showed up at our doorstep. Hey, I wonder: why didn’t you fall under its influence like everyone else?
I don’t know. I did fall under the control of one of those mutants in the past. It almost managed to zombify me, but then Fish saved me.

That Fish is certainly a good man. Anyway… Good thing you managed to steer clear of that controller’s influence, else we’d all have been on a leash. What was I thinking?… With our security, anyone can waltz in here without a problem. The really scary part is that these zombies have been wandering around the barn for a while, and that means that the controller was also under our nose this whole time…
Right now, we need to get the guys some more ammo. We won’t be able to protect ourselves otherwise.

You’re right about that, but the ammo shortage isn’t our main problem: our food supply is dangerously low, and we’re almost out of drinking water. The morale here is dropping every day. Several of our men are saying that there’s no way out of here and that we’re all going to die of starvation. I do get such thoughts myself from time to time, but I try to keep them at bay.
I’ll do everything I can in my power to find a way out of here.

I hope we can still find a way out of here, because I don’t want to die here. I didn’t think that the Zone would give me such a horrible present; to live out my days in this cage. I want to go back home to my wife and daughter. Why in the hell has this Zone entrapped me?
Yeah. The situation isn’t easy. Do you have any other task for me?

Listen, Beast: you look pretty beat up. You spent a lot of time in that bed, blacked out, but I can see it didn’t help you nothing. A face-to-face meeting with a controller isn’t the best treatment, either. Go and rest up; seeing you in your current state is painful. We’ll talk more in the morning. In the meantime, the guys and I are going to deal with the corpse of that controller.
Some shut-eye wouldn’t hurt.
Just a sec… Okay. The marker should be on your PDA.
Hey, Beast. Need something?
Then let’s go.
I’m listening, Beast.
Hey. Did you need something from me?

Yes, Beast. As you can see, we have a shortage of food and munitions. That’s not our only issue; on top of that, our amount of drinking water is dangerously low. I mean, there’s a well outside the barn, but the water in there is radioactive, and drinking any of it without any prior purification is life-threatening. But there is, in fact, a way to purify it. From time to time, you can find an anomalous plant inside this anomaly. At one point, I helped the scientists at Yantar with purifying water, and they did it by boiling the flower in the water.
You want me to go flower picking? Not my style.

No, Beast. You won’t have to pick anything. Cutter sent me the locations of a few such plants; he spotted them from the tower. You just have to stay by my side. The place is crawling with mutants, and I don’t have a lot of ammo to deal with them on my own. Will you give me a hand?
All right. I’ll cover you. When are we heading out?
Merc, we can talk later. Right now, you should deal with the zombies together with Mosquito.
Right now. If you’re ready, of course…
I’m ready. Let’s go.
Wait just a moment. Need to check my gear.
I’m listening, Beast.

We’re back, safe and sound. I have the plants. Thanks for covering me, Beast. Now, I’ll be able to work with purifying the water for the men. These plants should suffice for at least some time. By the way, if you run out of water, come see me, and I’ll be able to provide you some.
So, Beast, are you ready to pick some flowers?
I’m ready. Let’s head out.
Then I’ll go.
Wait a moment. Not quite ready yet.
No problem. I’ll come by if I need any H2O.
Hey, Beast. Need something?
My flask’s already empty. Can you fill it?
No problem, Beast. Hand it over.
Right. Here’s your flask.
I’m purifying the water. Waiting for it to cool down. After that, I’ll message you so you can come for the flask. Cool?
All right. I’ll wait for a message.
Here. Take your flash. The water’s all clean and cooled down. You can drink it right now if you like.
Thanks, Snake. You’re a big help.
Here’s the thing: I haven’t purified the water for you yet. We’ll deal with the flesh later. Once it’s done, I’ll give you a message. ’Kay?
The water’s still contaminated. Drop by a bit later.
’Kay. I’m ready to go. The water’s been purified; here’s your flask. Now, let’s go hunt some flesh while we still have our dinner waiting for us.
Thanks for the water. Put a marker where these flesh are at and let’s drop ’em.
Just a sec… Okay. The marker should be on your PDA.
Then let’s go.
All right. The flesh are waiting.
All right. I’ll go later.
Here. Take your flash. The water’s all clean and cooled down. You can drink it right now if you like.
Thanks, Snake. You’re a big help.
Hey there, Beast! So, you ready to shoot down a few radioactive piggies?
I’m ready. Let’s head out right now.
Great. Let’s go hunt some flesh while we still have our dinner waiting for us.
Put a marker where these flesh are at and let’s drop ’em.
My flask’s empty. Can you help?
No problem, Beast. Hand it over.
Here’s your flask.
I’m purifying the water. Waiting for it to cool down. After that, I’ll message you so you can come for the flask. Cool?
It’s a deal. I’ll wait for a message from you.
Tell me about your group.
Who do you want to know about?
I’ve changed my mind.

Cutter’s a strict man. He’s hard to understand, but he doesn’t cause a lot of conflict; on the contrary, he helps break up any arguing in the group, if it ever comes up. He ended up in the anomaly about two months ago. He couldn’t get it together for the longest time, but nonetheless, he adapted. His main role is reconnaissance, which used to be Scavenger’s thing. All in all, he’s a decent guy, but as of late, he’s been pretty down; he keeps talking nonsense about us being stuck here forever.
Thanks for the info.

About Sledge? Well, he went through thick and thin in his days. He’s like steel; a force of nature. Not a man. I knew him from before the whole fiasco with the anomaly. Back then, he worked with Freedom at the military warehouses. Everybody there cherished and respected him, but after he appeared here, he became different. He found friends among enemies here and generally became a kinder person. He’s been with us for about two and a half months.
Hm. So this place has some kind of use. Thanks for the info.

Quite a young fellow, who made the mistake of joining Duty; or rather, that’s what he believes. If he gains experience, he might become a very good fighter one day, but if he gets out of here, he probably won’t be joining up with his faction again. He made friends with Sledgehammer, though they both got pretty hot-headed when they first met ’cause of Sledge’s time in Freedom. He’s been here for almost over a month.

Markus is the musician here, and, if I may say, my right hand man. If there’s ever something I can’t quite deal with on my own, he’s always there to help me. He was part of the original group that ended up in here. We had a third guy, but let’s leave that for now. You could say that we brought some order to this place, if you can call it “order.” Eventually, some new stalkers came along, including yourself.
Thanks for the info.
Thanks for the info, Savage.

Mosquito used to be a marksman; hence, his accuracy is on top. If you need help from a good shooter, he’s the one to talk to. Regarding his other qualities, he’s a very kind-hearted and talkative man, and he never let his presence in the anomaly get to him. He’s been with us for about three months.
Tell me about Cutter.

Mosquito used to be a marksman; hence, his accuracy was on top. Regarding his other qualities, he was a very kind-hearted and talkative man, and he never let his presence in the anomaly get to him. He was with us for about three months. It’s unfortunate that he was killed in this anomaly.
Thanks for the info.

Without Knucklehead, we’d have been much worse off. He’s a hunter and a gatherer. After Scavenger came here, they’ve both been helping the group by supplying us with mutant meat. I don’t know how things would work out here without him. He’s been with us for over three months.
Thanks for the info.

Not much I need to say about Screw. He’s the heart of our group. Without him, we wouldn’t be able to maintain any of our equipment, and without equipment, we wouldn’t last very long. The guys hand him all sorts of trash, which he buys for money, and then, with the help of that trash, he fixes all of our gear. He doesn’t do it for free, but that doesn’t matter to us. He got here about a week ago or two after us, and since then, he’s been a steady helping hand.
Thanks for the info.

I won’t take up too much time talking about myself. I ended up here during the assault on Limansk. At the time, I was in a detachment in Clear Sky together with Markus and Shell. Everyone here ended up at the same time, and not everyone’s lived until the present moment. Shell was the leader of our detachment, and he remained our leader after our appearance in the anomaly… well, until he disappeared, after which I assumed his position.
Thanks for the info.
Not at all. If you want me to share more about anyone else, just ask.
Tell me about Sledgehammer.
Tell me about Snake.
Tell me about Markus.
Tell me about Mosquito.
Tell me about Knucklehead.
Tell me about Screw.
Tell me about yourself.
Hi there, Beast. You need something from me?
Markus should’ve returned by now, but there’s not a trace of him… Do you know where he went off?
Hm… Nope. I don’t know. He didn’t tell me anything. Wait just a minute; I’m going to try picking up his PDA signal.
All right. I’m waiting.
Beast, it seems I’ve picked up the Markus’ PDA signal… or, rather, his last signs of activity. Head over there at once. I can tell something’s not right.
Got you, Savage. Send over the coordinates and I’ll head there.
Beast, not now. Go to Markus’ last known location and find out what happened. We need to find him.
I’m here about the SOS.
I’m listening. Did you talk to whoever sent it?
Most likely.
Yep. The stalker who sent the signal is already here; I led him to the base.
I think you did the right thing, Beast. In a situation like this, you need to stick together. Another soul here won’t hurt. He does know where he is, right? Have you told him?
Yeah. I told him. When I found him, he said he was being pursued by mercenaries.

All right. Well, that’s a problem… Whatever. They’re probably clever enough not to end up in the anomaly. Beast, go over to him and ask him about himself. The more we know about him, the more he can be trusted.
Yeah. I’ll go talk to him.
I’m listening. Did you talk to whoever sent it?
The stalker who sent it was killed. I wasn’t able to bring him back to base.
Sad to hear. But the Zone is merciless. I’m sure you did everything in your power to save his life.
I found Scavenger. He’s dead.
How is he dead? Where’d you find him, Beast?
The stalkers Scavenger was looking for weren’t always dead; he killed them.
Strange. He never told us about that. Beast, we need to find that decoder; in all likelihood, it’s just what we need right now.
Don’t worry. I, too, want to find it.
Great to hear, Beast. As soon as we get more info about it, come to me and we’ll talk. What else was on Scavenger’s PDA?

Hm… Well, this is certainly his doing. I’m glad he tried to help us somehow. If you find his stash, bring it to base. We’ll find out what to do with it; it’s not like Scavenger needs it anymore. Did his PDA contain anything else?
So that son of a gun took all the most valuable loot for himself? God damn… If you find his stash, bring it to base. We’ll find out what to do with it.
You serious right now? Motherfucker! If I knew about this earlier, I’d have him pulverized. Good thing he kicked the bucket. That’s what he deserves.
Yeah. He was a slippery type, but now, he’s dead.
God dammit! And I trusted him all this time… Thanks for opening my eyes. Did that weasel’s PDA contain anything else?
Nope. That’s everything. You can have his PDA. It’ll describe everything in more detail.
By the fence. Apparently, he went through the teleporter to the north. That’s how I found him.
M-hmm. He turned out a slippery bastard. Prepare to find that decoder; in all likelihood, it’s just what we need right now.
Don’t worry. I, too, want to find it.
Great to hear, Beast. As soon as we get more info about it, come to me and we’ll talk. What else was on Scavenger’s PDA?

Hm… Well, this is certainly his doing. I’m glad he tried to help us somehow. If you find his stash, bring it to base. We’ll find out what to do with it; it’s not like Scavenger needs it anymore. Did his PDA contain anything else?
I’ve already found his stash.
Oh? Good work, Beast. What did you find in it?
Munitions, medical supplies, and most importantly, a locked container… and the stash had no key in it.
Mmm-hmm. Hand over that container. I’m gonna give it to Screw; maybe he’ll manage cracking it without a key.
Here.
I’ll call you as soon as Screw’s done opening it. What else was on the PDA?
Yeah… Sad. He was a sharp stalker. Saved us many times…

Yeah, turns out we didn’t know much about Scavenger at all… All right. So, Knucklehead was looking for you, and our fellow jarhead told us that he has something to say to you. Go and talk to them. I need some space to deal with my own business.
All right. I’ll talk to him.
Scavenger was sharp, but not that sharp. By the way, I forgot to mention something: he had a PDA on him.
What are you on about, Beast? And throw that thing away. There won’t be any useful on it…
As it turns out, it does have quite a few interesting entries.
Oh? And what did you find out from Scavenger’s PDA?
There’s an entry about him finding some kind of decoder that’s supposed to provide an exit out of the anomaly, but its location isn’t mentioned anywhere.
Scavenger kept his most valuable findings away from you and hid it all somewhere, but where exactly, I don’t know.
Regarding Scavenger: when did he go missing?

Scavenger went missing two days ago. He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him, Cutter and Mosquito, but they didn’t find him. Instead, what they found was you, but don’t get any wrong ideas; I’m glad you showed up. You helped us eliminate both the zombies and the controller, and for that, Beast, I thank you.
No need to thank me. I’ll go comb the area; maybe I’ll find something.
It’ll mean a lot if you find him. Scavenger was a good stalker. He’s been a great help to us.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot a message.
I found Scavenger’s stash.
Oh? What did you find in it?
Munitions, medical supplies, and most importantly, a locked container… and the stash had no key in it.
Mmm-hmm. Hand over that container. I’m gonna give it to Screw; maybe he’ll manage cracking it without a key.
Here.
I’ll call you as soon as Screw’s done opening it.
Got you, Savage. I’ll drop by later.
Can you tell me something?
Perhaps I can, seeing as it interests you.
What do you think about the other residents of the base?
What do you think? Are we going to get out of here?
Who were you before?
I changed my mind.
I’ll be off.
What’s there to think? They’re all right people. We’re all different, but the tragedy of this situation applies to us all; we’re united like cement.

I don’t know, but even if we do find a way, not everyone will make it. That’s for sure. I’m still amazed that we’ve been able to hold out for this long. Not only do we barely have any grub or munitions, but we have more dangerous concerns. I left the barn the night before yesterday to get some fresh air, and I could smell burning. I thought, “Maybe something’s burning…” but then I saw a huge pillar of smoke, and I could make out someone standing in the center of it. I looked through my binoculars to see who it was, but I couldn’t make out rat shit from dog shit. I decided to take a closer look, and suddenly, there was a laughter. All that smoke was gone, and so was the figure who stood in it. I don’t know what the heck that was, but it sure wasn’t anything good for us. It didn’t bode well.

I’m a stalker; a loner. I made a living working under Sidorovich, and after that, I set off to Yantar for science. They’ve got regular-paying jobs and medical supplies, and the military doesn’t poke their nose there. What sucks, though, is that those eggheads tend to send you to places so bad that even shit looks good in comparison. Before I ended up in this anomaly, I remember how I went up to an anomaly by myself at Yantar to gather a few specimens, and then all I saw was a white flash.
Oh, it’s you, merc. Looking better already. Thanks for helping us drive off the zombies.
And thanks to you for saving my hide. So, where’d you even find me? Maybe some of my equipment was left behind.

Of course I remember. How could I not? You won’t find anything there, though. I scouted that place far and wide. Tried finding your stuff by myself, and I also looked a the possibility of an exit from this hellhole, but, as you can see, I’m still here.
Send the coordinates anyway. I want to see it for myself.
Be my guest. There. You should have it. Check your PDA.
Thank you. Time to go find my backpack.
So, merc, what’ve you got?

Hey there, merc. I’m glad that you’re okay. I’m basically the local technician. You can bring me broken shooters, and I’ll buy them off you, though I don’t provide any repairs or modifications for free, because in the end, I’m going to get out of this place someday, so I try to gather whatever I can, and I also need to get hold of intact weapons in exchange for any parts. By the way, if you find any tools around here, then bring them to me. I’ll find a way to make use of them.
Hi, merc. Need anything repaired, or improved?
I’ll keep that in mind.
Come talk to me if you need anything.
How’s Scavenger’s container doing?

I opened it. Turns out there are quite a few goodies inside; even a few useful tools, which means I can now work on additional upgrades, but let’s leave that for later. As I told you in my earlier message, you can take some of this stuff for yourself, and I’ll share the rest with the others.
Give it to me.
I don’t need that. What else you got?
That’s everything. Not much else is left in the container; only medical supplies and bullets, which I’ll give to Savage. He’ll distribute it among the group.

No problem. Here’s your shooter. And, by the way, have a few rounds for it as a bonus. They were also in the container. It’s a rare caliber; a type that nobody here uses. Other than that, there are two packs of 5.45x39 mm military armor-piercing ammo. Very useful against armored targets.
That’ll come into handy. Give it here
Nah. I don’t need ammo right now. What else?
All right. Take the ammunition. What else… A Black Angel artifact. Not bad in its qualities; it gives you resistance to psy-fields. You want it?
Yeah. I’ll take it.
I don’t need it. Anything more?
Here. Take the artifact. Not much else is left in the container; only medical supplies and bullets, which I’ll give to Savage. He’ll distribute it among the group.
Then show me what’s inside.
Inside are two packs of 5.45x39 mm military armor-piercing ammo. Very useful against armored targets.
We also have a Black Angel artifact. Not bad in its qualities; it gives you resistance to psy-fields. You want it?
Great. See you, Screw.
Right. Let’s start with a 1PN58 scope. Very useful item. Contains a built-in night vision device, which’ll help you spot targets in the dark. It fits on weapons with dovetail-type rails.
I’ll take it.
Don’t need it. Show me more
Mhm. Here’s your scope. Let’s keep looking… Right. Here’s a decent pea-shooter: the FN FNP-45. Not exactly up to date, but its destructive capabilities are not disappointing.
I’m taking it.
I have no need for it. What else is there??
Got you. So, here’s a decent pea-shooter: the FN FNP-45. Not exactly up to date, but its destructive capabilities are not disappointing
I found a few tools. Here.

You found tools for basic work? They surely won’t be of much use for any fine work, but they’ll be handy nonetheless. Thank you very much, merc. I’ll lower my prices for repairs and upgrades for you. Deal?
Deal. See you.
Find the assholes!
So, merc, are you still occupied with anything? Can you help me out with something?
Remind me, what help do you need?

We could do with fixing the radio transceiver that’s located in this basement. For that, we need to find a working battery and two copper wire coils. It’s gonna take some luck and persistence to find a battery in these parts, but since we ended up here in the first place, I wouldn’t say our chances are too high… Copper wiring should be pretty easy to find somewhere, but without a battery, this thing won’t work. All in all, if you find anything resembling a wire or a battery, bring it to me. I might actually be able to fix this thing, and then you can try to send a signal that’ll reach outside the anomaly. Someone will surely get the signal and help us in some way…
You have me on board. If I find anything of note, I’ll bring it to you.
I’m busy right now. We’ll talk later.
So, what’s up, merc? Find anything?
Hey, merc. See, I’m resting up in here. Decided to go into the basement so that I don’t keep being an eyesore for the others. I think it’ll be better for everyone that way, including me.
I happened to find a battery all along. Another “lucky man” ended up in the anomaly and shared what he had.
I’ve found two coils of copper wiring.
Sad to hear about the stalker, but he’s helped us big time. I’d say I’m glad that he ended up here. So, hand me the battery. You sure it’s in working condition?
Here you go. It’s hard to say whether it works; he snatched it from a broken radio transceiver, but let’s hope for the best.
Here you go. It’s hard to say whether it works; he snatched it from a broken radio transceiver, but let’s hope for the best.

Okay. Let’s see… Yeah. That should do it. It’s just that even if this thing works, I can’t get it to restart yet. Got no copper wiring to replace the already fried wiring in here. Try to find two coils with copper wiring, and then we’ll try to get this pile of trash working.

Okay. Let’s see… Yeah. That should do it. If everything works out and the transceiver successfully restarts, I can send a signal for help beyond the anomaly. Come back to me in about twenty minutes. In the meantime, I’ll try to replace all the fried wiring.
Okay. I’ll come back in twenty minutes.
Hey there, merc. Let’s talk a bit later, you and I. Okay?
Well, that’s relatively good news. Savage told me you wanted to have a chat with me. Is that right?
All right. I’m going.
Hey there, merc. What is it?
Ah, it’s you, merc. Got any questions for me?
Hey, merc. I’m all ears.
Nope. Haven’t found anything yet.
Excellent, merc. Hand me the wiring. Too bad that not much will come out of it without a battery…
Here you go. Regarding the battery, I’ll try to figure something out, though it seems more and more that we won’t be able to find anything that’ll work.
Well, in any case, keep me updated. All right?
Yeah. I’ll be going now.

Yes, merc. Got a bit of an important task for you. I’ve found out that the radio transceiver that’s been lying in this basement can be fixed; I’ve had my moments with such devices before. The main thing of note is its broken battery, as well as some of the wiring having fried. I could use a couple of rolls with copper wiring and a new battery. Once I have all that, I might be able to breathe some life into that thing. It might save our day; if we get it working, we might be able to send a signal outside the borders of this forsaken anomaly, and if anyone gets the signal, maybe they can help us escape.
Excellent, merc. Hand me the copper wiring and come back to me in about twenty minutes. I’ll try to get the battery and the fried wiring replaced.
Here’s the wiring. I’ll come back in twenty minutes.
All right. I’ll try to find the wiring for you.
Come back in a little while, merc. I still need to get this thing repaired.
I managed to fix the damn transceiver after all. Now, we need to find someone that we can broadcast the signal to. That’ll be my business.
Did you pick up anything useful while you were fixing the transceiver?

It doesn’t seem like I’ve picked up anything. Might be a few phrases here and there along with some unintelligble muttering, but there are more than likely old broadcasts. I’ll keep scanning for any more signals, but nonetheless, thanks, merc, for helping me repair the transmitter. Who knows? Maybe it’ll can help us get out of here.
No need to thank me. We’re all together in this. I’ll see you later.
Good idea, but where am I going to find a battery, and one that still works, at that?
I’m busy right now. Let’s discuss that later.

I’m just giving us options, merc. It’s gonna take some luck and persistence to find a battery in these parts, but since we ended up here in the first place, I wouldn’t say our chances are too high… Two rolls of copper wiring should be pretty easy to find somewhere, but without a battery, this thing won’t work. All in all, if you find anything resembling a wire or a battery, bring it to me.
You have me on board. If I find anything of note, I’ll bring it to you.
What help do you need?
Hey there, merc. What is it?
Ah, it’s you, merc. Got any questions for me?
Hey, merc. I’m all ears.
Damn… Man… Give me a medkit, or I’m riding the pale horse…
We’re here… Thanks for the help. Who knows what would’ve happened if you didn’t come by. I’m feeling a bit better now. Can you tell me where we are? What is this place?
Have you ever heard about space bubbles?
Well, I’ve heard things, and I know what they do in general terms. What about them?
Congratulations: you’re in a spatial anomaly right now.

Well, then… Sucks that they sent us to fly today of all days… And most importantly, how the hell did we even end up here? This place never appeared in any of our maps. Whatever. What’s done is done. And, as I understand it, you haven’t found any way out of the anomaly?
Nope. So far, not a thing. Where are the other soldiers who were in the helicopter?
Just great… The chopper crew was most likely torn apart. Me, though… Seems like I got lucky. God damn aerial anomaly. Thanks to it, all electronics were fried in seconds.
Yeah. Anyway, get better, soldier. We’ll be needing your help soon.
All right. I’ll see if your shooter’s still around.
Hey there, merc. What do you need?
I’m finished… Man… Man, finish it. I won’t last…
Just you wait. I might be able to help you still.
You think I still have a chance? This pain is hellish… I can’t handle it… Relieve my suffering…
You’ll live; I’ve seen worse. First, we need to get you a medkit, so that I can get you back to base.
Alright… Do whatever you want… Just… Just make this pain stop… Give me your medkit…
Here.
I don’t have any medkit right now, but I’ll find one.
default text
